content:
4, 2014
												Risk of Rain could stand a little more optimizing, but for a game made in Gamemaker of all things it's surprising how engaging it is. The art style is consistent and manages to look great even when your character could be rendered on a digital watch. Combat is fast, constant, and feels good, character progression is a constant motivation, and the soundtrack is top tier. The multiplayer is absolute ♥♥♥♥, a total ordeal to set up which I assume is a limitation of the engine, and unfortunately I haven't been able to get it working. Despite that, Risk of Rain is closer to the traditional rogue-like with randomly-arranged stages, distinct character classes and randomized loot from a very large pool of options than most games professing to be "rogue-likes" on steam today.

er 31, 2013
												This game does what it wants to do properly well. It has it's flaws, but all in all, it's well executed and presents challenging gameplay with great difficulty balancing from easy to hard.The game does NOT handle well internet lag. It's supposed to be synchronized between the players, but with pings of around 300 ms, monsters started desyncing and, due to that, completing stages was only doable by the host, as I could not kill 'all enemies on screen'. The content that the game offers is worth it's price, but I would have definitely paid more money if it offered double the content. It's got 100 items and 7 classes so far, which isn't bad, but gets a little repetitive after a few hours. The key to making the game fresh is, instead, placed on the many classes you can unlock and play with. The soundtrack offers great tunes that motivate the players to keep going. It's very cinematic and complements the scenery in a really classy and well done way.Needless to say, this is much better enjoyed with friends, as all class combos offer great variety in strategies. The game's difficulty is much better adjusted for teamed up players, as different classes complement each other against certain monsters.No need to mention that this game is really hard. REALLY hard. Beating this on Hard difficulty is not a feat for the faint of heart.6/10

The more time you take to survery your area, the harderthe game gets.  Surviving in the game comes down to a combination of luck andusing passive abilities strategically.  That being said, the longer you take,the harder the enemy gets, to the point where the quantity of passive abilitieswill make no difference.This is not a game for those who have never tried roguelikes before;  ratherif you are looking for a challenge, this will entertain you, and even humble youas you go through the game. content:
y 26, 2015
												Risk of Rain is a platformer/sidescroller/survival game that puts you in control of one of a few survivors of a crashed spaceship. You will have to fight enemies and earn money to purchase upgrades and progress to the upper levels. The game's difficulty scales with the time, adding an incentive for players to use their time efficiently. In each individual "run" - or single playthrough - there are six levels, each with harder monsters and more expensive upgrades. Boss monsters appear at the end of a level or sometimes in the middle of a level if the difficulty is high enough. Risk of Rain will require several playthroughs to fully explore what all of the upgrades do and how to play each of the survivors.Read more for an in-depth look at Risk of Rain.This game's story is largely told in the beginning and end cutscenes, as well as in monster logs - information about enemies that randomly drop when you defeat one. Some of the descriptions in the item log also hint to background story events.Risk of Rain [ROR] is a 2D pixelated platformer game. The art is excellent and each of the characters and enemies are unique. Each of the survivors has 4 unique abilities that are fairly balanced. Each one has their own forte and shortcomings, so experiment a little with all of them to figure out which one suits you. You only start with one character unlocked (the Commando), so you'll have to unlock the rest.Items/upgrades are found in chests which unlock for a price. Monsters drop money and experience when killed, and both can also be found in small amounts within canisters. There are four ranks of upgrades - white (common), green (uncommon), red (rare) and orange (use item). The first three ranks are items that are either passive or triggered by events, while the fourth are items activated by the player. All use items and skills (except for the primary basic skill) have cooldowns. There is also an artifact hidden within each level. Artifacts do nothing in the run they are acquired in, but after that playthrough a new artifact's effect can be chosen in the character selection screen. Each one adds a different game element (only elites spawn, 500% damage but 10% health, etc).ROR also has an incredible soundtrack, merging genres from electronic to trance to ambient to rock. Each level has its own exclusive background music, giving it a unique atmosphere. The sound effects are very believable and yet are alien enough to convince you that the planet you are on cannot be Earth.Risk of Rain is an incredible platformer with solid gameplay mechanics, excellent replay value and an addicting arcade-style structure. Online multiplayer is also available. A solid game all-around. Definitely worth purchasing if you enjoy a good thrill.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
3, 2014
												Brilliantly-made roguelike platformer from the guys behind Starbound. While superficially similar to games like Binding of Isaac or other action roguelikes, there's really nothing that FEELS like Risk of Rain out there.The essentials: you are a survivor from the crash-landing of the UES Contact Light, which was hauling extremely questionable cargo when it was downed over an incredibly hostile alien planet. Play as one of eight different classes, pillage the wreckage that rained down from the sky as the ship crashed, and try your hardest to survive long enough to reach the Contact Light and get off the planet. This is a shallow summary, of course.The basic gameplay is an action platformer reminiscent of Bionic Commando, but there's no grappling hook shenanigans: instead, every class has a completely different style of play, with four abilities. Every class has one basic attack, one crowd control power, one ability that improves mobility, and one very powerful attack that leaves them somewhat vulnerable but is tactically crucial. These range from the basic Commando, who is a classical sidescroller Dude With Gun What Shoots Mans, to stuff like HAN-D, a hulking janitor bot who punches things and launches drones to attack and heal himself, to the Bandit, a space cowboy assassin with a lever-action rifle and dynamite, to even weirder and kookier options. Every class is completely unique compared to every other class, and there's a ton of variety to be found for any kind of playstyle you like. Beyond your class, you've got one slot for an active item and a functionally unlimited number of slots for passive items that improve your abilities or stats in some way. If you've played Binding of Isaac, you basically know how this works. Where a lot of the fun comes in is the sheer variety of items you can find and the way they interact with your character, as well as the intriguing and funny backstories behind each item, displayed in the game's Item Log, which is presented as the shipping manifest of the Contact Light. As you collect items, you'll eventually build a picture of exactly what the Contact Light was up to. The game similarly features monster logs for stuff you kill, which are random pickups.Difficulty in the game is complex; while the game has three difficulty settings(Drizzle, Rainstorm, and Monsoon), it isn't immediately obvious what these do. What they primarily affect is the game's scaling difficulty, which is based on your in-game timer. As the difficulty meter ramps up, enemies get progressively tougher, more aggressive, and more numerous; at the max end, it can even spawn bosses as regular enemies.In each level, you're looking for a teleporter which will take you to the next stage; activating it summons a boss, and once you've killed it and all remaining enemies in the stage, you can progress. You can either beeline for the teleporter straight off, or stay around for a while and try to slaughter enemies to earn money and experience with which to buy items and become stronger, but waiting TOO long becomes a risky gamble due to the ever-increasing difficulty. Too fast, and you'll be underpowered; too slow, and your foes will be insurmountable. Skilled play thus becomes a balancing act between progression and increasing your capabilities.The game is simple to pick up and learn, but is staggeringly replayable, and this is helped by the beautiful aesthetic and wonderful music. For ten bucks, you are getting a LOT of game, and it's certainly worth your time to stand out in the rain for a while.

												Risk of Rain is a very challenging pixelated game with RPG elements for a fast paced gameplay for you and your friends featuring a whole lot of unlockables, items and characters. When playing for the first time, even the easiest difficulty feels like a big hit. Great and forwardening soundtrack that always keeps you on your toes. For the current price the game does not really satisfy in regard of content.The game is not optimized well in terms of performance and visualization on the screen. When things are getting too cluttered, a low- to mid-end PC often hangs on a view strings and slows down to a unplayable state. The final level always lagged on my older notebook, regardless of hosted or being the host and the monsters on the screen.A huge let-down is the handling of lag when playing in multiplayer. The game often ended up being unplayble as the player with a high ping did not synchronize with the host, not being able to teleport to the next level.All in all I would recommend Risk of Rain when it is on sale, otherwise it feels like it is missing content and polishing.

I once played this game for 2:25~ hours straight. Didn't regret 1 second of it (except the time i died and the game ended)This game has tons of fun and replayabilitiy, which is one of the first things i look when i play a game. But that's just me. First of all, the game might seem boring. But if you advance further you realize how many different stuff you can get. You have many items to collect while playing and each one of them gives you an unique ability. Also they are separated in tiers;
White, Green, Red and Orange (usables) And around 80% of the items can be stacked, making them stronger and stronger as you collect more of them. But some have stacking caps.The game gets harder and harder as your progress. And if you play long enough, you might encounter the "overloaded" bosses. They take some time to defeat. Also most of the regular enemies turn into elite enemies. Them being elite lets them have special powers (depending on the color, if im right) and they have much more damage & health. I don't know if it counts as a spoiler or not so i will just say this: be prepared for the last boss. It's pretty hard to beat.(Updated)I cannot i believe i missed the 2nd best thing i like about this game! The amazing soundtrack by Chris Christodoulou! He did an amazing job on every track and i enjoy them everytime i play the game. I set my music volume to 100% just to listen to them.
I highly recommend this game. It is worth every penny. Get it on sale or just buy right now & get a refund if you are not amused one bit.

content:
er 6, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a rogue-like game, set in a science-fiction setting. If you die, you'll have to start again, but on your way to the next teleporter you'll collect lots of passive and active items and xp, helping you to survive the enormous numbers of enemies wanting to kill you. Also you should hurry, because the longer you play, the harder the game gets.It is a good game for people who like rogue-like games, e.g.  Binding of Isaac, although I think RoR is better.I got this game as a gift and was surprised how addictive this actually is. There are lots of positive points:+ lots of different items, enemies and bosses+ is extremely addictive+ sweet soundtrack and overall atmosphere+ some cool hidden stuff like artifacts and different characters you'll be able to play.+ good and precise controls+ quite cheap and you'll be able to play local coop or online coopRegarding the graphics, I quite like them, but you should like the pixel graphics style.So this isn't a pro nor a con, because it depends on your taste of graphics.As this game is quite awesome, it isn't perfect- while you can play this with a keyboard, I feel like you should play it with a controller, which makes life way easier for you- when starting the game, it is hard as hell, but you'll get a quite op character from time to time, making the hordes of enemies later in the game rather annoying than challenging- the last boss is a real oldschool son-of-a-♥♥♥♥♥ endboss. Although it would have been a strange feel to get an easy endfight after you struggled through the earlier levels, it is almost ridiculous, how difficult and long it takes to beat him.When I reached him, I already played around 55 minutes and it took me 25 minutes to beat that mofo. He is op as hell, but it is absolutely possible to beat him. I did, but found it annoying how long it took.- there are a few minor bugs, but nothing what should stop you from buying and playing this gameOverall, this game is an absolute gem you'll get for a quite cheap price, also during a sale you should probably get a four-pack for all of your friends. Of course there are some minor things I didn't like, but I think they shouldn't stop you form getting this one.Overall I'll give this one85/100

content:
ber 21, 2014
Risk of Rain is a sci-fi platforming roguelike where you pick a character and run through levels while collecting a massive selection of (stackable) items to make yourself stronger and more likely to survive long enough to find a way home. The catch is that the more time you spend alive, the more numerous and difficult the enemies become, so there is a trade-off between mining levels for items and speedrunning. Any fan of Spelunky will appreciate its extraplanetary equivalent, but there are a few less-than-desirable traits which should be of note.Unlike Spelunky, Risk of Rain has a diverse set of classes from whom to choose. However, I believe they could be placed on a bit more equal footing. Where many games of all kinds, from TF2 to The Binding of Isaac, make sure that different classes are well balanced, Risk of Rain has certain characters which are clearly far worse than the others (no matter what one's individual strategy may be). Contrary to the achievement name, you will find the Robot Janitor, and you will regret it. Classes like the Enforcer or the Robot Janitor are simply too slow to stand any chance against mid-game swarms of enemies. They are, indeed, powerful classes, but the level difficulty ramps up too quickly to avoid the swarms (whether you choose to search for items or speedjogataleisurelypace). If you do not quickly find several of the same very specific items, you will die more frustrated than entertained. The other "weaker" classes have some method of teleporting or defense-rolling to safety, but there is no health pool large enough to save you from enemies too numerous to kill and too fast for you to run away. That said, playing as the other classes yields a roguelike challenge with items and enemies worth the time and money.Overall, Risk of Rain is a good game with uniquely designed aesthetics and gameplay mechanics. This sci-fi roguelike poses a challenge which, though sometimes frustrating, still maintains considerable replay value.8.5/10

content:
ber 25, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a game you will try and fail in. Then try again and get a little further. Then try once more and get not quite as far as the first. There's a lot of elements to this game that are random. The biggest of which is the item drops. The quality of the items, the rarity and quantity are randomly generated. That not only makes Risk of Rain feel random, but also makes it challenging. For some reason I'll get further and last longer with worse items. Makes me think I'm on my game! The randomness can feel frustrating or unfair at times, but it adds major replayability.There are a lot of pros and cons, but just know... Risk of Rain is a fantastic game. There are different characters you play as and unlock. You also unlock droppable items through achievements and tasks. The characters all play incredibly different. I believe there's 10 different options. In the game you'll spend the majority of your time dodging and platforming - trying to trick the AI into not being able to get to you. The difficulty also ramps up for every 5 minutes you play (up to 60mins). So ideally you'll clear the level, get all the items and kill the boss all in one sweep. That's usually not the case, since you have to kill enemies to gain money to unlock a chest.A major flaw I've seen is the multiplayer. It has huge potential for a fun multiplayer experience but they missed it just a bit. You can play with 4 players in one screen. That screen does not get split. You must travel CLOSELY with your companions. I'm uncertain if online multiplayer allows you to split off. That's not the flaw, however. The upgrades are how you get more powerful. Only one person can pick up the upgrade, and upgrades are not shared. So you can either choose to split the upgrades between you and your buddy/ies and all be weaker, or have one person pick up every upgrade and have the others feel useless. This can also add some tactical measures to the game as well. If you know the upgrades well enough, you can give the ideal upgrades to the different classes and maybe be stronger as a unit then you would be with one godinator and 3 scrubby nubbies.I'm tempted to say this game is ALMOST too challenging, but it wouldn't feel like an accomplishment if it were easy to make it to the end, now would it? I've played maybe 30-40 runs and completed once or twice. Damn it felt good when I beat it. Play this game. Beat it with every class. Be my hero.

content:
ber 11, 2014
												Really drags you in once you try it. I couldn't help myself and just went on playing with the purpose to reach 100% achievements, however stopped at 97% with few monster logs missing. It has an enormous replay value, which sadly ends once you unlock some artifacts (Kin, Glass, Command, Sacrifice) and items (infusion, chargefield generator). Once you get them, starting on a lemurian map, grabbing early infusion and stacking on barbed wire soon makes you and unstoppable ball of death and after 30 minutes of farming you always beat monsoon regardless of the character choice. That kinda killed the fun for me, as I couldn't just go back to the regular style of playing after trying that. All in all though, the point where you can possibly roll through the maps every time you play start after you've played for some 20 hours or so already (if you are fresh new to the game), probably less if you've played it before or read the wikis a lot.Before that I still had lots of fun, trying to survive, which is not always that simple. If you play it the regular way, your every gameplay will be different, some items will make cleaning the levels a breeze, while other sets will push you to change your strategy in order to prevent your painful death. The graphics might be a little archaic, but I think it synergizes well with the game overall and it actually looks pretty neat. The background music is prefect as for a space survival game, it fits well with the atmosphere of being on another planet, alone. Another great thing about the game are the monster logs, which I found very well written and enjoyable to collect and read.RoR doesn't escape few minor bugs like item containers (the always come in three and you can buy only one item) sometimes spawn all in the same place, so you can't even really see what you might get or some items not working properly sometimes (looking at you Imp Overlord's tentacle), but it's nothing gamebreaking. For me, the most annoying issue was the FPS rate in later stages of the game, I mean, I don't really have a gaming rig (yet), but for a game that doesn't involve any too complex graphics, I think it should run smoother rather than lowering my details to the minimum and the FPS rate dropping to 20-30 (which also affects the clock, so the in-game time is not the same a real life time).Still, for such a low price, this game is well-worth buying. It costs like 3 euro, when there's a discount running, which is a funny price for the fun I've had, especially with the AAA games having 5-10 hours of gameplay with no replay value at the cost of 40 euros. I recommend it to everyone who likes games with roguelike elements and is a completionist freak like me.

It is a great side scrolling open platformer/shooter/nommer/exploder that keeps you hooked for hours. I will be playing so much more of this game. The soundtrack is sublime, a mix of electronic synths with glockenspiels and metallaphones with time signatures to fry your brains it is worth opening Spotify or Youtube (go to the composer Chris Christodoulou's channel) and listen to the whole thing. Masterpiece.One thing of note is the online functionality at time of writing is a mess, unfortunately there is no LAN and the system for connecting requires one to open up ports in their internet, so it is a fiddly process.

content:
9, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a "Rouge Lite" platformer developed by two college students under the name Hopoo Games. In the game you control one of twelve total characters, marooned on a strange and unknown planet, each with their own abilities, stats and uses. You traverse the multiple levels attempting to get back to the ship you crashed on the planet with, facing enemies and bosses of increasing strength and gathering the lost cargo of the ship to make you more powerful along the way.This is a 2D action platformer, where, as previously stated, you attempt to get to the final level and escape the planet you were marooned on. As you play, you unlock more characters and items in a similar way to The Binding of Isaac where as you play and make progress, you gain new items and characters. The characters are all different and have different abilities across the board. The default character, The Commando, have a high fire rate and deals moderate damage, but high knockback, making him a good crowd control character. On another end The Sniper has an ability that guarantees critical hits on stronger enemies, making him much better for bosses or singular targets.The goal of each level is to reach a teleporter to, you guessed it, teleport to the next level after fighting a 90 second long wave of enemies and killing all the enemies before you can progress. There's a unique difficulty mechanic in this game, it becomes more difficult the longer you play, what I mean by that the seconds that you spend in each level increases the difficulty, adding a sort of risk reward system when you have to decide if you should farm the level more or check for items that you missed,Overall, Risk of Rain is a high quality game that I'd recommend to people who are looking for a challenge or a good game to play with friends, did I mention this was Co-Op? Yeah, it is. Risk of Rain gets a 9/10 from me.

content:
y 3, 2014
												This is absolutely worth the buy, addictive, a real good replay ability and one of the most fun games i have ever played.Of course, its always based on the players taste, i will recommend this game for ALL medium players, new people should wait a bit to play this game, because it is quite hard and you will regret getting it, get a bit more of experience in video games and then you can enjoy I know i may not have played it alot, but i know i will.Multiplayer: a very good multiplayer with easy hosting, no need to open an individual dedicated server and configurate it until it works, either port forward it or play in LAN, host a game and have fun! I have not yet tested playing online but from what i have seen, people with bad internet will not lose game experience, it is still as playable.Combat: I have found myself mashing all the buttons when i first played it, with a German keyboard that changes the Z and Y i almost thought the first skill didnt work until i noticed it, after i found out that there is an first skill i got a lot more strategic, you cannot only stand in one place and PEI PEI PEI, you need take advantage of the enviroment since birds that can fly through walls will eventually come get you.Every character has a different skill list, i found every character that i have unlocked so far very unique. The starting class, the Commando is still my favourite and i love to play as a strategical shooter.Unlockables: This game has an HUGE ammount of different and unique items, 10 classes and it will take a while to 100% this game.Every class has a different way to be unlocked, some may be a challenge and others you will just eventually unlock them.What has surprised me the most about this game is how much items there is, and what every one of them do.I have no idea how many items this game has but everytime i find a new one it doesnt a bit like the others, one of them does something special and unique, you can also hold all of the items you find through the game!There are also "Use items" that serve like a 5th skill, you can only hold one and i find it hard to choose which one is coming with me, mostly the ones that the bosses drop because they are the strongest and help alot.How does it play: As the trailer says, the game gets harder as you play, it gets harder with the difficulty you choose and its already hard by default. This game is a real challenge, but the challenge is what makes it fun. While you play the game the game count for how many time you have been playing it, it will be filling a bar at the top right corner of the screen and it can get pretty stressful, you always get scared of exploring the world because you will be losing time and fears that the game is getting harder, its like someone is following you.Apparentally the game has many different levels for the stages, there is a variation of teleporter locations and levels that you will get, the map may never be the same.tl;dr: you a patient and skillful player? get it, you new to video games and not patient? dont get itvery funny thanks guysi will be playing this gamerightnow

content:
14, 2015
												Frustrating? Yes, at times, but the rewards of playing are always there.Difficult? Yes, at times, but it becomes a question of, "what can I do better next time."Items? Each unique, different item, with their own little charms, backstories and effects, giving a nice depth to the game.Artifacts? Difficult to earn, each one providing a deeper level of play, often a double-edge sword perk, but some are just downright cruel.9 Artifact Run? "ded" -Risk of Rain10 Artifact Run? "rekt" -Risk of RainPossible to do a run in under 40 minutes? Sure. You'll probably farm some gold on each level, so you can access all the shrines, chests and other available objects, but otherwise, should be beaten in under 90 minutes per average game.The game will taunt you.The game will laugh at your misery.But the game is rewarding, there is a small learning curve, but it's the difficulty curve that is your greatest challenge.Overall 9.5/10; minor bugs and stuff that doesn't really matter, it's a really good game.Soundtrack 9/10; extremely fitting for the game, decent playlist for listening to while not playing the game.*Some users have reported some difficulties with Multiplayer, but isn't that normal with anything online?10/10 would get "rekt" again.

												Oh my god this game is amazing for the price you pay... it's so friggin' addicting! You start off all weak and normal, but as you go on you can level up from XP that enemies drop, along with money they drop that you can spend on chests and shrines across the map that give you random items that buff your character. When you activate it, a boss will appear and you have to survive for a minimum of 90 seconds. After that, you have to finish off the boss and all the smaller enemies around it. Then you can teleport into the next level/area and repeat the process from there. A+/10, buy this game.

												Risk of Rain is a game in which you truly feel adversity with every step you take. It's an incredibly difficult game, but that tends to come with the rogue-like territory. The characters all feel fun to play as, and it's always incredibly satisfying picking up yet another new upgrade to add onto your already extensive pile of upgrades. content:
er 5, 2013
												RoR is a very agressive, colourful pixel orgy of side-scroll platforming, run and gunning. You crash on a hostile alien planet and need to get away from it or the wildlife will get to you. You survive by mowing everything down, getting expierence, gold and collecting/buying powerups. There are 10 characters you can play as (Although you start with just one, others are unlocked by progression or other objectives) each has their own unique set of 4 skills. E.g. Shooting at mobs from multiple directions, charged shots, leaving behind a trail of bile that hurts mobs but boosts other players or temporarily invisibility.The powerup items you can find are passive or active; some of the more simple passive one's will increase stats like the % damage and health you regenerate and active items can be used during combat. Missle launchers, saw blades, minefields, a jar filled with the vengeful souls of monsters. All very fun to try out. The strength in what keeps making you play this game is that the items are randomly generated and chests or shrines you can find them at are also randomly scattered across the levels you play in. (Of which the order of 4 out of the 6 levels are chosen randomly too) The mobs hit really hard and while in the beginning of the game you need skills to time dodging attacks, luck is a big factor in getting the right items to make you powerful enough to beat the game. As time passes the mobs increase in quantity and power, dealing even more damage. In the heat of battle it is easy to lose sight of your character Playing online co-op has to be done through Hamachi which isn't too much of a hassle and playing with a controller didn't go very smooth for me, it doesn't recognize my 360 controller unless I use a controller emulator. Once you have those things set up it's a blast. You won't need an umbrella!

												There is a lot of variety here, great replay value, and it's down right addicting. You start out with little to no knowledge of what you're doing and where you're going but after a few deaths you'll find out how to succeed. content:
y 3, 2014
												This is absolutely worth the buy, addictive, a real good replay ability and one of the most fun games i have ever played.Of course, its always based on the players taste, i will recommend this game for ALL medium players, new people should wait a bit to play this game, because it is quite hard and you will regret getting it, get a bit more of experience in video games and then you can enjoy I know i may not have played it alot, but i know i will.Multiplayer: a very good multiplayer with easy hosting, no need to open an individual dedicated server and configurate it until it works, either port forward it or play in LAN, host a game and have fun! I have not yet tested playing online but from what i have seen, people with bad internet will not lose game experience, it is still as playable.Combat: I have found myself mashing all the buttons when i first played it, with a German keyboard that changes the Z and Y i almost thought the first skill didnt work until i noticed it, after i found out that there is an first skill i got a lot more strategic, you cannot only stand in one place and PEI PEI PEI, you need take advantage of the enviroment since birds that can fly through walls will eventually come get you.Every character has a different skill list, i found every character that i have unlocked so far very unique. The starting class, the Commando is still my favourite and i love to play as a strategical shooter.Unlockables: This game has an HUGE ammount of different and unique items, 10 classes and it will take a while to 100% this game.Every class has a different way to be unlocked, some may be a challenge and others you will just eventually unlock them.What has surprised me the most about this game is how much items there is, and what every one of them do.I have no idea how many items this game has but everytime i find a new one it doesnt a bit like the others, one of them does something special and unique, you can also hold all of the items you find through the game!There are also "Use items" that serve like a 5th skill, you can only hold one and i find it hard to choose which one is coming with me, mostly the ones that the bosses drop because they are the strongest and help alot.How does it play: As the trailer says, the game gets harder as you play, it gets harder with the difficulty you choose and its already hard by default. This game is a real challenge, but the challenge is what makes it fun. While you play the game the game count for how many time you have been playing it, it will be filling a bar at the top right corner of the screen and it can get pretty stressful, you always get scared of exploring the world because you will be losing time and fears that the game is getting harder, its like someone is following you.Apparentally the game has many different levels for the stages, there is a variation of teleporter locations and levels that you will get, the map may never be the same.tl;dr: you a patient and skillful player? get it, you new to video games and not patient? dont get itvery funny thanks guysi will be playing this gamerightnow

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 6, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a rogue-like game, set in a science-fiction setting. If you die, you'll have to start again, but on your way to the next teleporter you'll collect lots of passive and active items and xp, helping you to survive the enormous numbers of enemies wanting to kill you. Also you should hurry, because the longer you play, the harder the game gets.It is a good game for people who like rogue-like games, e.g.  Binding of Isaac, although I think RoR is better.I got this game as a gift and was surprised how addictive this actually is. There are lots of positive points:+ lots of different items, enemies and bosses+ is extremely addictive+ sweet soundtrack and overall atmosphere+ some cool hidden stuff like artifacts and different characters you'll be able to play.+ good and precise controls+ quite cheap and you'll be able to play local coop or online coopRegarding the graphics, I quite like them, but you should like the pixel graphics style.So this isn't a pro nor a con, because it depends on your taste of graphics.As this game is quite awesome, it isn't perfect- while you can play this with a keyboard, I feel like you should play it with a controller, which makes life way easier for you- when starting the game, it is hard as hell, but you'll get a quite op character from time to time, making the hordes of enemies later in the game rather annoying than challenging- the last boss is a real oldschool son-of-a-♥♥♥♥♥ endboss. Although it would have been a strange feel to get an easy endfight after you struggled through the earlier levels, it is almost ridiculous, how difficult and long it takes to beat him.When I reached him, I already played around 55 minutes and it took me 25 minutes to beat that mofo. He is op as hell, but it is absolutely possible to beat him. I did, but found it annoying how long it took.- there are a few minor bugs, but nothing what should stop you from buying and playing this gameOverall, this game is an absolute gem you'll get for a quite cheap price, also during a sale you should probably get a four-pack for all of your friends. Of course there are some minor things I didn't like, but I think they shouldn't stop you form getting this one.Overall I'll give this one85/100

content:
er 3, 2013
												Risk of Rain is a Indie/Platformer with rogue-like elements. In Risk of Rain you fight through hordes of Enemies that spawn on the level your in and they keep spawning more over time as you try to go through the level, collecting items, killing the Enemie waves, and trying to find the teleporter/exit. You get Gold and Exp. through killing the Enemies that you can use to unlock chests or pray to shrines to get access to items that help you through the game. When you get to the teleporter you have to fight through a 90 sec. spawning wave while trying to kill the boss of that level. The game gets harder the longer you play. It starts off very easy and it can go to the hahaha difficulty if you survive a long enough time. The point of Risk of Rain is to survive as long as you can while trying to get a lot of items that can help you throughout the game and to help you kill the final boss....if you can survive that long that is...Mwahahahah.

 Description Risk of Rain is an action platformer/adventure game with randomized elements. The game is set in the distant future, where space transportation is common. Space trains carry passengers and goods all across space. A particular space train, however, had some very special cargo. Through a series of unfortunate events, this space train gets shot out of orbit and crash lands on a mysterious planet.. with one survivor. Review Enjoyable game with high replayability and unfair difficulty.[+] Pros- Fresh gameplay- Randomized encounter- Permadeath- Twelve characters with his/her/its own tactic and playstyle- Three difficulties to playa. Drizzle (Not even casual)b. Rainstorm (Don't be panic, dude)c. Monsoon (Motherfather anchestor of Dark Souls)- Increasing difficulty after the game starts- Online and Local Co-Op- Simple but cool art and music[-] Cons- Bit buggy- Frame dropsFrustating, but really fun.

												Risk of Rain. Not really sure why they named it. They should have named it "holy ****ing **** the ammount of **** carnage and the ***** **** *** **** **** crazy ammount of deadly enemies trying to kill me and the intensity. or something like that. I don't even know, all I know is this game is intense, and extreamly fun. Risk of Rain is a Roguelike so you have one life and one life only. Every time you die you get to restart, but do not fear! while the game can be tough, but the items you get along the way and the characters skills can help you get through the levels.The enemies aren't as diverse as they could be, but it still provides a lot of randomization and that along with different classes and items provides replayability. Three difficulties allows you to play the game your way, slowing the progression of enemies or speeding it up.The games difficulty scales over time, providing an exciting system of difficulty, to the point where bosses will eventually spawn as normal enemies, and normal enemies will be nearly as strong.Risk of Rain provides an endless amount of fun for hardcore gamers and casual gamers alike, along with alot of unlikes it's sure to keep you busy for a while.

content:
er 28, 2013
												I had had my eye on this one for a while, and when a friend asked me if I wanted to play I impulse bought it on the spot. It turned out to be not only one of my best sale purchases this holiday season, but one of the better games I have played in a long time.It is essentially a hardcore roguelike styled action platformer, shortform and with huge amounts of replayability due to colectables, quite a wealth of characters with 4 different abilities each and a plethora of items to unlock and pick up.- Story: There is not much of an initial story except for the opening cinematic, but as you unlock more characters and monster logs through the game more of the story is filled in. At no point was there a moment where I had to stop and look at the story so far, as it is an action platformer ultimately rather than some long winded fantasy sci-fi epic, but the way the devs have filled in bits of story via logs and such is quite well done.- Sound: Music wise, the developers have chosen quite apt styles of music for the different stages, while creating an atmosphere that suits the gameplay and themes quite well. The sound effects are something else though; each enemy has an attacking noise, as do the weapons and powerups you accrue, and eventually you get to know the sounds of each. This doesn't sound like much, but in a game such as this these sounds are both well fitting and incredibly useful to keep track of enemies in your vicinity.- Gameplay: I think of this as a side scrolling version of Binding of Isaac meets Super House of Dead Ninjas, with an added layer (or 40) of difficulty.Each playthrough is different and items per each run can make or break it for you, as they can in BoI. However, the mechanics and verticality are far more similar to SHoDN, with things being frantic on the screen most of the time. All of this combined makes the game quite fun to play through, and I highly recommend it.As always, it is perhaps best to watch videos of the game before buying, and it is rather difficult alone. If you have a couple of friends to play with it is an absolute blast, and after you unlock a few things playing solo is also quite doable. As of yet I have not gotten to/beat the final stage/boss, but even after I have I will keep playing to unlock more items that become available. Definitely a recommended purchase.This was my first reviews as well, hope it helps someone out there!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
4, 2014
												Risk of Rain is a spectacular game that I wish I had known about long ago. It is easily one of my favorite games considering its replay value, difficulty, and the absolute carnage in-game. The gameplay is really fun, especially since you are annihilating hordes of mobs with class specific skills and items found in the zones you explore. Risk of Rain starts out fairly easy, but as the timer increases, so does the difficulty. This means a 90 minute game will have bosses, elite units, and waves of other enemies swarming you as you try to reach the endgame. All of this and it has multiplayer. In my opinion the best parts about Risk of Rain are the numerous items you can find on each level and the high skill cap that may be intimidating to new players at first. But fear not, as this game is really fun once you figure out your playstyle and strategy to advance through the zones and reach the final boss. Risk of Rain is a fresh breath in the world of 2D Coop Tough-as-Nails rogue-like indie action shooter-platformers with a great soundtrack, so buy it.

It takes a little while to get into, but it's very fun once you get the hang of it. It's also one of the few games which I purchased at their full price and I can definitely say it was totally worth it.8.5/10

content:
er 23, 2013
												Woot! Having a ton of fun with this game so far. It's fast, frantic and completely chaotic at times. Since the game's difficulty scales with time spent versus character level, it forces you to keep up your pace or risk falling beneath the power level of the monsters. One of my only complaints for this game is it can become difficult to tell what's happening when particularly large groups of monsters (or groups of particularly large monsters!) and attack animations are going off. Definately the sort of game that you can play in a half-hour stint, or a four hour binge. There is a large variety of meta-game unlockables (including new items to find in-game and new classes) that keeps you wanting one more round. Co-op is tons of fun as well! Local works perfectly, and while I ran into a few (mostly minor graphical) issues with the online co-op it was still incredibly fun and didn't detract much from the experience. Recommend!8.5/10Pros:-Multiple difficulty settings for rookies to vets-Unique unlockable character classes-Crisp, fast-paced action-Play alone! Play split-screen with friends beside you! Play online with friends everywhere!-Cool soundtrack/art style... + explosionsCons-Minor issues with online co-op-Action can become obscured by... the action

The one thing i love about this game-more than the fact that you can play it over and over again without getting bored, and that there are a seemingly infinite number of items that you can unlock- Is that you can play with your friends. Overall this game is fantastic, not only is it just AWESOME, has great pixel art, and a great replay rate but best of all you get to play with friends. P.S. the music is ♥♥♥♥♥♥icly amazing8.5/10

												★★★★★★★★☆☆Really fun rogue-like platformer. It's a difficult game to begin with, but as with games like this, the more you play it the better you become. There's a diverse range of enemies, bosses and unlockable characters to play, but the pick-ups recieved aren't all that different as they mostly modify a property of your health or damage. It's not all that noticable, but certainly is something to consider.The levels aren't randomly generated, but the locations of objects within the level are. At first it seemed like this would get tiresome, but it allows you to become familiar with each map layout, exploting different points with different characters.Pros:  Fun yet difficult, lots of bosses, classes and enemies, randomly generated objects on the map.Cons: Somewhat similar pick-ups when looked at as a whole.8/10.

content:
12, 2014
												Risk of Rain is an action platformer rouge-like with a pixel art aesthetic. Before any of you say ~nu uh shut up~ I realize it isn't "like rouge", its a platformer, but genre definitions are a ♥♥♥♥♥, so it's a rouge-like. Deal with it.Risk of Rain is amazing. Its pixel-art is some of the nicest and most detailed I've ever seen, and some of the few pixel aesthetics games that don't strain my eyes and give me a headache. Its combat is very well done and very varied. It has an item system similar to Isaac only they STACK, and a timer which makes the game progressively harder the longer you take. On one run you could feel totally powerless and on another, very similar run, you could feel like a total badass who can't be stopped. Every variable is a wild-card and everything is very well balanced. You never feel like an obstacle is insurmountable. When you die you know that somewhere up the line you screwed the pooch, either by not taking the time to scavange for items or taking too much time and ramping the difficulty way up; both usually happen on level 3. The unlock system is put together nicely, too. Whenever you find a new item or monster log, you get flavor text that really sets you in the world (Mars isn't a nice place, be glad you aren't there). The "plot" is kind of non-existant, but the atmosphere is fantastic.All that being said, this game has one major, glaring flaw that really sets the whole experience back leagues. If you know how most rouge-like-lite-ish-esque-jimminy-crickets go, you'll most likely picture a 30-60 minute venture into a few set evels to find random loot and hopefully become over-powered enough to emerge victorious, and Risk of Rain is no different. However, a main mechanic in making a successful rouge-like is to make everything that happens somewhat fluent. To use Isaac as an example, while most vets spend 5 minutes on the first floors, 10 in the middle, and maybe 15 on the final floors in they're crap at it. This is where RoR is flawed, and to elaborate I'm gonna have to spoil something, so turn away if you cared about the story past "You crashed, shoot worms". The final boss is KOOKOO BANANAS ♥♥♥♥ING INSANELY LONG. My first fight with the guy went around 18 minutes. Thats about as much as the first 2 levels combined. And not only that, but its BORING as hell. There maybe once in the entire thing where I felt slightly threatened, and that was towards the very end of it. The rest of the entire fight was me running back and forth and occasionally turning around to spit at the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. There was no engagement, just frustration that it wasn't over yet. And what makes matters worse, is that the 1rst and 3rd phases are THE SAME. The only difference is that the 3rd phase adds a clone that you can't attack to damage the boss, so it just makes the running parts way longer and the spitting parts fewer and farther between.This one part of the game is a huge blemish on an otherwise fantastic gaqme. The visuals are great, the atmosphere is great, the combat is great, and the end is a pile of horse ♥♥♥♥ tied to the back of a deranged chimpanzee's pickup truck being driven through the tundra where the snow is replaced with bile. Despite this, I still great;y recommend this game. You should buy it right now. Just skip the end. Or at least make sure you have a portapotty or a coke can near by because you won't be going anywhere for a good while.

content:
ry 22, 2014
												Ignore what Steam says, I've been playing the game for well over 60 hours.If you want a challenge, Risk of Rain does not disappoint. Although the concept of getting to the teleporter at the end of each level is simple, and there are only 6 levels in any single playthrough, it just doesn't get old. Ever. After dying 2-3 times I looked up at the clock and an hour and a half had passed. The incredibly addicting gameplay and a near endless amount of items give this game a very similar feel to The Binding of Issac.It's hard, but not unfair.Difficult, but rewarding.Sometimes makes you rage and throw your computer, then pick it back up again and give it 'one more go'.There are tons of unlockables and achivements to test your skill. Beating them unlocks more items and characters as to help you make it further in your next run. Like I said, there are only 6 levels in any one playthrough, but the first four can be switched at random, leading to a total of 10 areas and more to explore. Different stages spawn different enemies, and your teleporter, chests, items, and idols won't be in the same place during your next run. Heck, the same bosses won't even show up. I'd been playing the game for 2 days and found a boss I'd never seen before. Beating the game requires both skill and luck to get the right items. And since no two playthroughs will ever be the same, you can't just expect to get the items you've been hoping for, but you make what you get work.If you like tough games, lots of variety, and simple gameplay that just doesn't get old; Buy Risk of Rain.Also, I can honestly say this game has one of the most fun and just downright enjoyable (yet difficult) final bosses I've seen in a game, which has also become a personal favorite of mine.There isn't much that this game does wrong. 9/10

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
er 27, 2013
												What happens when you leave a couple college students alone in their room with Gamemaker studio and a plethora of games from their past to influence them? Risk of Rain happens. A genre bending, wait...make that a blended indie sweetheart who made it through the trenches of the Steam Greenlight program. Cross a roguelike with metroidvania, sprinkle on some 4 player co-op and dangle a tasty bunch of useful collectibles in front and you’re left with one of the best co-op games I’ve played this year.For a game where I’ve died more times than survived, it feels weird recommending Risk of Rain. I usually warn players against overly difficult games unless they know what they are getting into, but I can’t express how important it is to experience Risk of Rain. The variety of items, enemies, and environments gives it almost infinite replay value. Players are free to experiment with team combinations, item loadouts, and classes. The unlockable items and challenges will keep even the most hardcore busy, but it is really all about grabbing a group of space travellers and dying over and over again.

content:
ry 12, 2014
												Risk of Rain is definetely a hard one to review for me.  I find it a rather frustrating game that I continually return to playing and I was left having a hard think on why that is, both in terms of the frustration and in terms of why I keep returning.  Risk of Rain has been something of a mixed bag for me.Someone looking at my other reviews - Teleglitch or SotS: The Pit - will see I'm no stranger to roguelike games and I quite enjoy them.  I don't really find them usually too frustrating and they haven't really seen any ragequits.  But Risk of Rain has.  Why is that?  I think it basically comes down to the fact that the feeling I get from the game is very much that the random nature of the game is such that if you do not get favourable drops pretty much fairly all the way through you're going to have a very difficult time even at the normal difficulty.  This wouldn't be so bad if the easy difficulty didn't penalise you for using it - your progression is not saved when you use the easy mode.  I'm of two minds when it comes to that difficulty.  One one hand, the difficulty is one of the definete genre staples of roguelikes.  On the other hand, other roguelikes I've enjoyed had an element of definete skill to them whereby even with a poor random seed you can still get by if you are really, really good.  Risk of Rain definetely feels exceptionally unforgiving in that random aspect.  It's something to bear in mind.  If you're looking for a more "rogue light" experience, Risk of Rain is definetely not what you are looking for, but if you enjoy a challenge, I think you will probably find that attractive in Risk of Rain.  It definetely has that in spades.Speaking of difficulty, one of the more unique mechanics in Risk of Rain is the idea that the difficulty level increases across incremental levels as time elapses, whether or not you are active.  This creates a paltiple tension and as much as I have my difficulty with the random aspect, this particular aspect is something I really like about the game.  There is no rest break in this game, you have to keep going or something will murder you horribly, and that much definetely is a very roguelike thought indeed.  I quite enjoy that part of it.The biggest strength of the game lies in it's audiovisual style however.  It has a very strong and fairly unique aesthetic that is well executed.  I'm actually kind of sad there isn't a soundtrack DLC as I'd buy it in a heartbeat: the soundtrack is utterly captivating and very well composed.  The game itself uses a very "retro" pixel art style, but pulls it off well, and the art in some of the monster logs available through the menu are very well-done examples of that particular style.  I just adore the aesthetic of the game, and when I sit and consider why I keep coming back, its to delve a little more into that world and the lore that surrounds it.  It's strange for a roguelike but I get a definete feeling of exploration in learning the environment and it's lore.All in all, it's a very difficult game so if you're looking for a more casual experience, I couldn't reccomend it, but if you enjoy a challenge to your game, Risk of Rain does indeed offer a challenging and carefully-crafted experience that you would be very silly to at least not give a spin.[edit]: Fixed some typographical errors.

												One of the few roguelikes I have legitimately loved. Part of what sells this one for me is that you can unlock alternate characters who play quite differently, as well as artifacts that greatly affect how the game is played. Perhaps my favourite mechanic is that each level has a risk/reward of "Do I stay and get more items and let the difficulty rise or do I rush to the next level", which greatly adds tension. Fantastic game alone or with friends.

content:
er 31, 2013
												A solid (and nicely priced) game, Risk of Rain is fun and the perfect introduction for newbies into the genre of games with roguelike elements. It's easy to jump into, controls are simple, lots of hidden unlockables for replayability, and the gameplay is straightforward. The straightforward gameplay has its pro's and con's. Personally, I think that it limits the game somewhat, because it does seem more repetitive than say, Binding of Isaac or Spelunky. The randomized levels don't make much of an impact here than it does in Spelunky. And the loose-nature of RPG-styled combat makes battles less intense compared to Binding of Isaac. But the lack of complexity, IMO, is what makes multiplayer possible and enjoyable. Now... if only there was matchmaking for the online.

(via comment war) OTHERWISE let's get into it.This game is difficult. know that and know it well, You're gonna die a lot. So if you get frustrated easily...glhf.Risk of rain is a 2d shooter which has some of my favorite kinds of things, Items with effects that help you ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ upyes, that's right. ♥♥♥♥. ♥♥♥♥. up. (<- good)Like the binding of Isaac it gets difficult the further you go, however in this game, it's way different. There are three main difficulties you can pick, Drizzle, Rainstorm, and Monsoon. (wow rain!) This is the base difficulty, I'd recommend Drizzle if you're new just to get the mechanics of characters down really.But difficulty does not stop there. You're difficulty INCREASES by the amount of time you spend, so don't go pickin flowers son. Is it worth your money? Yes. content:
, 2014
												Hello, I am here to tell you about Risk of rain, a sidescrolly, itemy roguelite that has a trailer so confusing and uninformative that I wouldn't have picked it up if I hadn't heard about it before. -Important Sidenote! I am not critiquing the game, merely reviewing it.-In Risk of Rain you are a traveler on a space courier ship that's attacked by a mysterious... thing. Causing you to fall to the ground of an unfamiliar alien planet, where you fight for your life. Picking up items dropped by the ship and ultimately finding your way back to the fallen ship to fight the menace and leave the planet.When you first go into the game, you walk around the landscape and monsters will start to spawn, though slowly at first. You will then kill them, as they threaten your life, picking up their gold, which you then use to buy items out of the chests that have fallen down with you. When you first start playing, you will only have a small selection of items to find, but as you play more, you will unlock more, and these are persistant across lives. The difficulty increases over time, making monsters tougher and making them spawn more often, until you either die, or finish the game.  So, is it good? Hell yes. It definitely is fun to play. It has a nice growth curve towards the start, both with unlocking items through "achievements" -eg, kill 20 golems in one life, or activate the third teleporter without taking damage- and through increases in player skill, both with the game and with it's myriad of classes. Classes that, are unlocked through slightly bigger and harder versions of the achievements for items. -eg, kill 3 bosses or activate 40 drones in total.- It also has nice gameplay, that although slow towards the start of a game, gets progressively harder and faster paced as time goes on.Expect to die in your first few runs.The items are fun to use, with most of them providing unique effects that are not just simple stat bonuses. It's really refreshing. Having good items for your class is another challenge the game throws at you, as they all have different movesets with cooldowns as you use them, and different items will complement different classes much more than others. But of course, this all depends on what strategy you are using.Though there are complaints to be had.Risk of rain has a nasty thing called randomness, this can be good or bad, depending on your viewpoint. Some runs will be really easy, since you got good items from the -mostly- random chests, but others can be sabotaged by bad drops. Although I find that this can be overcome by player skill (and slightly balanced by the stat leveling system the game employs) this is a quirk of the genre that  can be good or bad. It makes the good runs stand out, certainly, but putting it the time to get there, at least initally, can be a slog. (I personally like it... now).The game is also short, but very high quality. Being a completionist, I have put a disproportionate amount of hours in. -More if you count the fact that I did most of the early game offline. It's not a big immersive rpg. It's a short sharp game you will play for, a week maybe, and will have you utterly hooked. it provides a unique blend of elements that makes it stand out and provide an experience like no other. You can keep coming back to it, sure, but it's not going to change much, and you will get bored of it eventually.UPDATE.Recently, however, there was an update the added artifacts that can change the game significantly, this can make the round you are playing unique to you and anyone else playing with you. This adds a new level of replayability to the game, making it last for much longer.I hope I've provided some insight.

												All the other reviews on the store page will tell you its genre and gameplay mechanics, so you already know all about how awesome those are.  Instead, I'll tell you about what will happen after you obtain this game and try it out:First, you'll be a little overwhelmed by the enemies and quickly advancing difficulty.  But, you'll figure out a good strategy or two for taking on some enemies, and feel pretty good about it.  "Perhaps this wasn't a bad purchase," you'll think.Second, you'll begin to realize that several hours have passed and you have started over a few times.  You have two full rows of items at your disposal and you're going back through the first level for the second time.  You'll wonder if perhaps you should go to bed.Third and finally, you'll experience a burning desire to play this game when you have some free time.  You'll listen to the soundtrack regularly because it's so delicious, and you'll see little item or teleporter outlines when you close your eyes at night.  You'll be able to identify and name all the items you see by icon alone, in no time.It's really a wonderful game!  I had no idea, until I got sucked in.

												დღეს მინდა Kickstarter-ის მეშვეობით ხორცშესხმული კიდევ ერთი, სკამოდ ორიგინალური პროექტი სახელად Risk Of Rain წარმოგიდგინოთ. თამაში ამ ბოლო ხანებში პოპულარული ჟანრის Roguelike წარმომადგენელია და თანამედროვე "მოდიდან" მასში საკმაოდ ბევრი დეტალია თავმოყრილი, მაგალითად ავტოგენერირებადი ლოკაციები, კოოპერატიული რეჟიმი ოთხ კაცზე, რეტრო სტილიზება, საინტერესო ვიზუალური გაფორმება და მაღალი სიძნელე (სამი რეჟიმით). სათამაშო კლასი ათი, ყველა მათგანი სხვადასხვა სტილის გეიმფლეით გამოირჩევა, სიცოცხლე მხოლოდ ერთი, პლანეტა უცნობი და აგრესიულად განწყობილი. დანიშნულება მომდევნო ეტაპზე გადასასვლელი პორტალის რაცშეიძლება მოკლე დროში პოვნა და მასთან ახლოს მყოფი ბოსის განადგურებაა (რაც უფრო დიდ დროს დაყობთ ლეველზე მით უფრო გაგიჭირდებათ მასში გასვლა). მაგრამ არის კიდევ ერთი საინტერესო მომენტი, კერძოდ კი ნივთები, ნივთები რომლებიც გმირს სხვადასხვა შესაძლებლობას უმატებს. Risk Of Rain გეიმფლეის წარმატების ფორმულაც ზუსტად მოცემული, მთავარი დავალების პარალელურად, თქვენი პერსონაჟისათვის გამოსადეგი ამუნიციის ძიებაში მდგომარეობს.წყარო Gameover.ge

content:
0, 2014
												It is not uncommon for human beings to find themselves bored with the monotony of regular life. Day after day we find ourselves experiencing new things, yet we still long for something. We feel as if we need an escape from the world in which we find ourselves. This need has given rise to a plethora of movies, books, and games, among many other things, to distract us from our life. It is with this same feeling that I decided to embark upon such a distraction.Leaping forth to immerse myself in a new world, I was excited at the new possibilities it offered. Although my character's landing had been rough, I was optimistic for the future. What never before seen wonders would I uncover. What beauty that had yet to grace the sight of man would I be blessed to lay my eyes upon? The imagination of man falls short in the face reality and I knew not what I would come across. The wonderous awe I felt as my feet touched the ground of this new world would be torn brutally away. Naïvety soon wears out its welcome, as did I apparently.What followed was a quick and horrifying descent into madness. As I gazed upon the flora of this new world, never having seen comparable beauty in Earth's, I was soon greeted with the fauna. A surprising variety of creatures met me with death in their minds. I fought as hard as I could, killing many, but the longer I lingered, the more arrived and the more dangerous they were. An endless flood of enemies assailed me, precious little time was I safe.Worse still were the monsters who were so much greater than the others. Towering beasts of great strength and tenacity hunted me down. Desperation seeped deep into my bones and I began to savour those rare moments when the creatures of a new area had yet to discover my presence.I would watch as the many different beings who so oft fell dead before me lived. They went about their bussiness, so similar to the animals of Earth. Realization struck me, I was the alien in this world, the terrifying invader. I represented an outside force that, if I was being totally honest, would in all likelyhood destroy this world's life for greed.It allowed me to take a step back and gain a new perspective on my existence. 'My' fight for survival, humanity's fight for survival, comes at a great cost. What right did I have to murder so many, just so I could continue on? In what way can I justify so many lives lost for my own? The same can be said for us as a whole. We slaughter our way through countless animals without a second thought. We do not visit new land, we destory it. We do not give to this world, we take from it. It's an eye-opening experience in which everyone should partake. This game is no mere escape, it is a wake up call. Scared and confused by my new outlook on life, I was in a daze. My only consolation whilst traversing this desolate virtual land... it never rained.

												Risk of Rain is a great action platformer game.With an 8-bit look like graphics, but still beautiful environments, the game challenges you to stay alive as far as possible. Easy to learn, maybe hard to master until you find your favorite character.Of course, there are some complications: the online game is a little bit tricky, you must give your IP and select a port to work, but aside that you'll have a lot of fun with this game.I strong recommend if you like platformer / action games.

ry 17, 2015
												9/10Overview: 2d Rogue-Action/Platformer The Good:+10 characters each with their own unique attack and abilities. +Randomized levels every time you start a new game. +Over 100 items ensuring lots of variety+Plenty of things to unlock. You first start out with only one character: the commando and a handful of items. As you play and complete challenges, you unlock more characters and items making it easier to get to the end of the game. +Every good rogue game I've played has a nice sense of pacing. What seems like an impossible task in the beginning slowly becomes easier once you start understanding the mechanics. Making it to the last boss is a very satisfying feeling. + One of the main premises of the game is that as time goes on, the harder enemies become. This creates somewhat of an interesting balance to the game. Normally you may think that you should just complete each level as fast as possible however this may leave you underpowered in the next level. Take too long in a level and you may find the enemies too hard to defeat. Finding the right balance between killing enemies, collecting as many items in a level and staying above the difficulty curve is part of the strategy. + I love the music. Fantastic soundtrack. The Average:Although there are 10 character to choose from, some of them are not that good compared to others and some were designed with multiplayer in mind. Online multiplayer community is dead ConclusionThis is one of my favorite rogue games on steam. It has an addicting quality to it. Playing each character, getting rare items and having a good run is one of the hallmarks of a great rogue game.

content:
er 3, 2013
												Similar Games:Super Smash Bros, The Binding of Isaac and to a lesser degree TerrariaThe Good:A fun mix of a roguelike action platformer with boss battles thrown in.The artwork, while sticking to the retro trend, still manages to be impressive.The item variation is well-designed with unique names and artwork for each.The timer element definitely increases the tension as well as the excitement as the game progresses.Similar to The Binding of Isaac, the items you find can make the difference between “a good run” and a fairly quick and brutal death.Levels are quasi-randomized, adding to the unique feel of each run.Multiplayer is a ton of fun (although with a caveat – see The Bad).Higher difficulty levels/later stages get just plain crazy with the amount of carnage on the screen (again, with a caveat – see The Bad).The playable characters vary greatly, with the unlockable ones requiring a fair amount of skill to play.The game allows you to beat the game in a “straight run” or revisit earlier levels to farm items before attempting the last boss.The music fits the atmosphere of the game perfectly, although after a couple playthroughs you’ll be wishing there was more than a handful of tracks.The Bad:The jump timing is a bit off. More than a few times, I’ve missed a simple jump because the game couldn’t process that I was hitting move and spacebar simultaneously.Multiplayer is more fun than single player, however…Multiplayer has a number of bugs: 1) If you die, sometimes you can’t switch between spectating the remaining players 2) The boss timer tends to display different information to each player, e.g. I’ll see the timer has finished while the other player sees 15 seconds, etc 3) A fairly cryptic error message will sometimes appear in the upper left corner of the screen, then disappear.The multiplayer lobby needs a few tweaks, such as leaving the IP visible, letting players re-select characters, showing character names/abilities, etc.Once you reach higher difficulty levels and/or the final stage, the game lags horribly due to the amount of items on-screen at once.A game running on Steam in 2013 requiring a direct IP connection makes no sense.This game does not like alt-tabbing.Sometimes the game just crashes for no apparent reason.The Writing:Most roguelikes skimp on the writing, but Risk of Rain actually has a fair amount of quality writing contained in the item log. Aside from that, the writing is limited to randomized one-liners when multiplayer participants die, half of which sound like they were written by someone either in middle school or from ♥♥♥♥♥.Did I make time to complete it?Definitely – although The Bad may seem to outweigh The Good, this game is still one of my top games of 2013. I’ve played Risk of Rain since the beta, and the full Steam version for over 16 hours.Recommended Purchase Price:This game is *easily* worth $9.99 – I’d pay $20 without hesitation.or200% of current retail value of $9.99Reviewer:Mudlabhttp://www.gamersglance.com

content:
y 25
												Activate the teleporter and hop in to proceed to the next level. A timer will be shown once you have activated it and need to survive spawning enemy waves for 90 seconds before the teleporter can be used. Defeat enemies, farm their gold and open chests with it for items. Items will give you perks. The problem I have with this game is the lack of balance. There a 2 scenarios possible. You are lucky and farm good items and become godlike or unlucky with item spawns in that you are unable to proceed further. When you have farmed good items and become godlike (there is no item cap) it involves zero skill and all you do is kiting and let perks do their job of killing mobs. The game throws so many enemies at you later on that it turns into a kite fest and most characters and their abilities become useless. There is no mechanism that prevents you from getting overpowered and still able to tackle enemy mobs without kiting. The game clearly lacks any balancing from mid to late game. You are also unable to play this with two controllers in local coop which doesn't make sense. Great concept and potential but ultimately falls short by design issues.

content:
30, 2016
												A fun and challenging 2D sidescrolling rogue-like in which you can get a demi-god adrenaline rush by stuffing many powerful artifacts down your space trousers and making hundreds of dudes face the wrath of your explosive fury. Start as one dude, unlock many other dudes with varying abilities by doing certain things, like beating the game, etc.The difficulty of the game slowly increases as time goes on, so you and probably at least one other friend should split up, and balance between murdering space dudes, getting their exp, gold, items, collecting items from chests by spending money you've collected (because videogame), and finding the teleporter in a timely manner which initiates a gauntlet for about 90 seconds and spawns a boss which you must then destroy. After the gauntlet is over and the remaining enemies are dead, any player can use the teleporter to proceed to the next level.Rinse and repeat several times until you get to the final level, and kill the final boss who wants you and your comrades incredibly dead.In short:> Explore, shoot things, collect items, find teleporter> Hold out, shoot more things, enter teleporter> Repeat, reach final level, beat snot out of final dude, probably unlock more dudes> Repeat> Go mad with POWER!!!!!!!

												Risk or Rain is an absolutely amazing game to purchase. It's very addictive and interactive. Absolutely worth the $10.00 I paid. It does get a bit hectic though. Hectic to a point that some lower-end computers will get some lag issues (but in my experience, if you farmed a bit, you should have at least a bit of lag by the end level). It does have a bit of issues with multiplayer too. The replay value of this game is absolutely phenomenal. I've replayed the game countless times and it's still very fun to play, both singleplayer and multiplayer. The amount of different scenarios that arise are almost endless. I highly recommend this game to anyone that likes rogue-like games or a game that really grabs your attention. :) :)

content:
9, 2015
												Risk of rain is fantastic! The game has a very simple yet detailed pixel art style, and interesting monster, weapon, and character designs, each masterfully animated.The music seems to be inspired by retro game beats, yet feels fresh, and oscillates from being adreniline pumping, to calm and relaxing, it's a good, fun, varied sountrack. The simple yet deep gameplay, offers various characters to unlock, each offering very unique movesets that all have been perfectly balanced, so one should be able to find one character that fits their playstyle. While the game is hard, it never feels so due to monsters having an unfair advantage, however several artifacts can also be unlocked to alter gameplay so it either ends up easier, or more difficult. Additionally three difficulty levels can be selected, so you can cater the challenge to your own tastes.The gist of the game is to fight off a neverending wave of enemies, that become progressively more difficult the longer the game is in play, over the course of 6 levels. Each level is completed by first finding a teleporter, then fighting off against a boss, and surviving a time limit wherein serveral enemies will spawn to attack the player, after successfully doing so the player will be transported to the next level.A lot of work went into the design of the game, from the easy to navigate menu's, to the environments available, and amount of enemies you can come across, to the games ostensibly simple story that reveals more depth as you dig into the lore. Along with the many secrets, hidden areas, and unlockables to discover.Multiplayer is a blast, but unfortunately very difficult to set up with others...Risk of rain is fun on all levels, and an excellent addition to the indie genre, that should keep one entertained for hours!Score: 4.5/5 -0.5 due to the difficulty in setting up a multiplayer game.Sincerely,- Celx RequinWebsite: www.cancer-cinema.comTwitter: www.twitter.com/cancercinemaSteam Game Page:

content:
er 28, 2013
												Risk of Rain is an enjoyable Rogue-Like action focused platformer with a great soundtrack. Although it has slight problems with game life and multiplayer, I suggest buying this game. Now we shall go onto the specifics of the game. Risk of Rain is a Rogue-Like platformer that has 10 classes; each of these classes has 4 different skill sets allowing for a very diverse game experience. There are 11 different areas in the game, each with a few different stage layouts. Not every session the player plays will actually consist of all 11 areas. Most sessions, players will only see 5 stages. Each stage is laid out very well that isn't confusing nor unfair for combat. The combat of the game is very strong. It also can remain diverse because of the different classes. Each class possses a different skill set that can be used for different situation. The Commando, being the starting class, is the most all around class in the game. The Sniper, being an unlocked class, is the most situational class in the whole game being that it is a boss killer.Like FTL and Rogue Legacy, the game can get tiring faster than wanted. I played about 3 hours on the day of purchase because of its solid gameplay. As the week continued, the desire to play the game and the amount of time spent started to dwindle. I found that after the intial high of the game, I really didn't have a huge desire to play the game. That doesn't mean that Risk of Rain is a bad game. The multiplayer can easily increase the life of the gameThis brings up another problem with Risk of Rain. The multiplayer is not very simple to set up. You have to go through and get your IP and open ports up on your computer. The hardcore computer gamer should be capable of doing this with no problem, but that doesn't mean that the process is not annoying. Dying in multiplayer can also make it a very boring game if playing with someone who is much better. There is no way to revive your friends; all you can do is beat the level or die. All they can do is watch and hope you die. To conclude the review, Risk of Rain is an enjoyable Rogue-Like action focused platformer with a great soundtrack. Although it has slight problems with game life and multiplayer, I suggest buying this game. Now we shall go onto the specifics of the game.
